uqa.dataset moduleÂ¶

Classes to load and save data.

DataLoader and DataDumper are designed to work with/as DataIterable types, while encapsulating the different dataset structure and format specificities.

Examples

Read a single file pickle dataset, process it and save a single json file:

>>> # Load a single pickle file
>>> dataloader = FileDataLoader("data.pickle", fileformat="pickle")
>>> # Processing returns an `DataIterble` object with a single element
>>> data_it = some_processing_step(dataloader)
>>> # Get a path_modifier which simply returns a new path
>>> path_modifier = DataDumper.path_replacer("foo/data.json")
>>> DataDumper(
...     fileformat="json",              # save in JSON fileformat
...     path_modifier=path_modifier,    # use new path
...     json_indent=2,                  # set json indentation level to 2
... ).save(data_it)                     # Save the processed data
>>> # File 'foo/data.json' is created and contains the processed data
>>> # if 'foo' directory doesn't exist, it's created.

Read a multiple-file json dataset, process it and write result in a new directory.:

>>> # Load multiple json file
>>> dataloader = FileDataLoader(["data_train.json", "bar/data_eval.json", "bar/data_test.json"])
>>> # Processing returns an `DataIterble` object with a 3 elements.
>>> data_it = some_processing_step(dataloader)
>>> # Get the path modifier
>>> path_modifier = DataDumper.file_in_dir("foo")
>>> DataDumper(
...     fileformat="json",              # save in JSON fileformat
...     path_modifier=path_modifier,    # use new path
...     json_indent=2,                  # set json indentation level to 2
... ).save(data_it)                     # Save the processed data
>>> # Files 'foo/data_train.json', 'foo/data_eval.json', 'foo/data_test.json'] are created
>>> # if 'foo' directory doesn't exist, it's created.

Read a directory json dataset, process it and write result in a new directory.:

>>> # Load all json file in directory "bar" and its sub-directories
>>> dataloader = DirDataLoader("bar")
>>> # Processing returns an `DataIterble` object.
>>> data_it = some_processing_step(dataloader)
>>> # Get the directory modifier function
>>> path_modifier = DataDumper.dir_replacer("bar", "baz/foo")
>>> DataDumper(
...     fileformat="json",              # save in JSON fileformat
...     path_modifier=path_modifier,    # use new path
...     json_indent=2,                  # set json indentation level to 2
... ).save(data_it)                     # Save the processed data
>>> # For each file with path "bar/{subpath}" a file "foo/baz/{subpath}" is created.
>>> # All non-exsting directories and sub-directories are also created
uqa.dataset.TJson = typing.Union[typing.Dict, typing.List]Â¶
Json-like container, representing data usually in default format.
See â Data Formats
uqa.dataset.DataIterable = typing.Iterable[typing.Tuple[str, typing.Union[typing.Dict, typing.List]]]Â¶

Dataset Iterable, each element is a pair (path, fcontent)

  • path (str) â Fileâs path

  • fcontent (TJson) â Fileâs content

uqa.dataset.write_json(fpath: str, fcontent: Union[Dict, List], override: bool = False, indent: int = 0, **kwargs) → None[source]Â¶

Write fcontent json-like structure at path fpath.

Parameters

  • fpath (str) â Relative or absolute path of the file to write.

  • fcontent (TJson) â Json-like content to write.

  • override (bool, default=False) â If a file with path fpath already exists and overriden is True the file is overriden, else if override is False a FileExistsError exception is raised.

  • indent (int, default=0) â JSON indentation number of whitespace to use, use 0 for compact JSON

Keyword Arguments

kwargs â Ignored.

  • override (bool, default=False) â If a file with path fpath already exists and overriden is True the file is overriden, else if override is False a FileExistsError exception is raised.

Keyword Arguments

class uqa.dataset.DataLoader(datapath: Union[str, Iterable[str]], fileformat: str, dataformat: str = 'default', sort_filename: bool = True, skip_file_cb: Optional[Callable[[str], bool]] = None)[source]Â¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Data loaders base class.

Derived classes only need to implement filepaths() abstract methods.
Manage dataset reading for single or multiple files dataset and allow to specify a directory as a dataset.
Iterating over an DataLoader instance will yield each file path and content.
sort_filenameÂ¶

If True file path and content pairs are sorted in lexicographic order relative to the path. else files order is randomized

Type

bool, default=True

skip_file_cbÂ¶

If provided, each fileâs path in the dataset is passed to this callback, if the callback returns True the file is skipped

Type

Callable[[str], bool], default=None

See also

DataIterable

__init__(datapath: Union[str, Iterable[str]], fileformat: str, dataformat: str = 'default', sort_filename: bool = True, skip_file_cb: Optional[Callable[[str], bool]] = None) → None[source]Â¶
Parameters

  • datapath (str or iterable of str) â

    Path(s) to a file or directory.
    A path to a directory will be recursively explored and files with the correct extension will be considered part of the dataset.

  • fileformat (str, ["json", "pickle"], default="json") â

    A supported fileformat.
    With "json" fileformat only *.json will be matched when exploring a folder.
    With "pickle" fileformat only *.pickle will be matched when exploring a folder.

  • dataformat (str, ["default", "fquad"], default="default") â

    One of the supported data format.
    The given value is only stored and does not affect the instance behaviour.

  • sort_filename (bool, default=True) â If True file path and content pairs are sorted in lexicographic order relative to the path. else files order is randomized

  • skip_file_cb (Callable[[str], bool], default=None) â If provided, each fileâs path in the dataset is passed to this callback, if the callback returns True the file is skipped

property datapathÂ¶

List of path passed at initialization.

Type

list of str

property fileformatÂ¶

File format, one of (json, pickle).

Type

str

property dataformatÂ¶

Data format, one of (default, fquad).

Type

str

property num_filesÂ¶

Number of files in the dataset.

Type

int

class uqa.dataset.DataDumper(fileformat: str, path_modifier: Callable[[str], str] = None, override: bool = False, json_indent: int = 0)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Data dumping class.

Implement fetures for saving a DataIterable in JSON or Pickle format as well as path modifier factories.
path_modifierÂ¶

A callback to transform path.

Type

Callable[[str], str], default=no-op

overrideÂ¶

Flag setting existing file overriding behaviour

Type

bool, default=False

json_indentÂ¶

JSON indentation number of whitespace, ignored if using Pickle fileformat

Type

int, default=0

property fileformatÂ¶

File format, one of (json, pickle).

Type

str

save(data_it: Iterable[Tuple[str, Union[Dict, List]]]) → None[source]Â¶

Apply path_modifier and dump the elements in data_it.

Parameters

data_it (DataIterable) â An iterator of the data to save.

make_skip_cb()[source]Â¶

Return a function taking an input path as argument and check if the modified path exists.

The modified path of a given path fpath is the result of applying path_modifier to fpath

static noop_path_mod(fpath)[source]Â¶

A function returning its argument without modification.

static dir_replacer(from_dir: str, to_dir: str) → Callable[[str], str][source]Â¶

Function factory returning a path modifier function replacing the last occurence of from_dir to to_dir in the path.

Parameters

  • from_dir (str) â A directory name (doesnât allow multiple directory)

  • to_dir (str) â A string to substitute from_dir with (accepts mutliple dir, i.e. âfoo/barâ)

Returns

Callable[[str], str] â A function taking a â/â-path string as an argument and replacing the last occurence of from_dir with to_dir.

static path_replacer(new_path: str) → Callable[[str], str][source]Â¶

Function factory returning a path modifier function replacing the whole path with new_path.

Returns lambda _: new_path
Used for single file dataset.
Parameters

new_path (str) â The new_path to return

Returns

Callable[[str], str] â A function taking a single argument and returning new_path.

static path_in_dir(new_dir: str) → Callable[[str], str][source]Â¶

Function factory returning a path modifier function joining new_dir and its path argument.

Returns lamda fpath: os.path.join(new_dir, fpath)
Parameters

new_dir (str) â A directory name (accepts multiple directory, i.e. âfoo/barâ)

Returns

Callable[[str], str] â A function taking a â/â-path string argument fpath and returning the joined path of fpath in directory new_dir.

static file_in_dir(new_dir: str) → Callable[[str], str][source]Â¶

Function factory returning a path modifier function joining new_dir and its path argument filename.

Parameters

new_dir (str) â A directory name (accepts multiple directory, i.e. âfoo/barâ)

Returns

Callable[[str], str] â A function taking a â/â-path string argument fpath and returning the joined path of fpath filename in directory new_dir.
